title: OMG VARUS MID
body:
At least its not Varus first item frozen heart top

From UOL vs FNC Game 1

replies.body: And I was just wondering if they would do some crazy picks for the fans, or take it seriously and win the game. Looks like they did both. xD

> [{quoted}](name=AbodyHUN666,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=E0G09Gr7,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-04-19T16:03:05.602+0000)
>
> And I was just wondering if they would do some crazy picks for the fans, or take it seriously and win the game. Looks like they did both. xD

a lot of their success comes from playing counter-meta champion. They know what to expect from their opponent, while noone can realisticly know what to expect from them. A lot of people just look at their picks and think they play yolo style, but in fact they play exactly what is good against what their opponent are playing. This next level of though in their draft phase is what make them so successful.
I just wish Frozen Heart Varus top was a counter to the meta
It took Riot less than a month to nerf Varus last time he saw LCS play for more than one game in a row.

But he didn't get played more than 1 game in a row

We are still ok for now

>Implying Lee Sin is still a problem

>Implying this myth holds any ground so far this season

>Implying

It was a counter to Kassadin

Which is pretty damn smart
As a counter pick it was a great choice, Kalista can't deal with 3 tanks either.

I'm surprised by the Manamune pickup on him though, that item has very little synergy with his kit (it doesn't apply on *any* of his abilities at all, Varus doesn't need tons of mana even when going full AD poke build, and it leaves him very weak early game when Varus usually is pressing his lane bully advantage).

I think either a more typical AD build or an AP build would have been much better in that match, but hey, they won with it anyway...

> [{quoted}](name=junglerboy16,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=E0G09Gr7,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-04-20T02:15:50.246+0000)
>
> I'm surprised by the Manamune pickup on him though, that item has very little synergy with his kit (it doesn't apply on *any* of his abilities at all, Varus doesn't need tons of mana even when going full AD poke build, and it leaves him very weak early game when Varus usually is pressing his lane bully advantage).
> 
> I think either a more typical AD build or an AP build would have been much better in that match, but hey, they won with it anyway...

{{item:3042}} does however go well with a very armor pen heavy build.
Tear has horrible synergy, not Manamune. Its like Ezreal
Unicorns can be damn proud of their showing these Playoffs. So can Fnatic, but they weren't nearly as fabulous.

> [{quoted}](name=TemporalDonut,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=E0G09Gr7,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-04-20T04:05:01.819+0000)
>
> Unicorns can be damn proud of their showing these Playoffs. So can Fnatic, but they weren't nearly as fabulous.

The Varus mid was pretty dam good legit maybe. I am surprised they never went back to it.
I wonder how it would have done in Game 5 cuz they had a Braum and a pretty squishy enemy
